Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a brown pottery slightly ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially grey-black in section, the interior is spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of three lines of Coptic text written in black ink, writ large.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394666) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394666)
